alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 15 at 9:57AM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Significant flow expected in the Whitewater River and the Coachella Storm Water Channel through Tuesday morning. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Riverside. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 AM PST, Heavy rain has fallen over the San Bernardino Mountains and will be draining into the Whitewater watershed through Tuesday morning. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the watershed in the San Bernardino mountains. - Additional rain is expected over the area tonight through Monday morning. This additional rain will continue the flow through the Coachella Canal through Tuesday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Indio, northern Palm Springs, Coachella, Cathedral City, Palm Desert, Rancho Mirage, Thermal, Whitewater, La Quinta and Mecca. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
